snippet: The cargo is part of a 1,300-ton stockpile of toxins removed from Syria under an international deal brokered last year and brought to Italy.
abstract: Specially equipped United States vessel, Cape Ray, loads toxic chemicals at an Italian port for destruction at sea in latest phase of an operation to remove and destroy about 1,300 tons of Syrian chemical weapons including mustard gas and raw materials for nerve agent sarin.

byline.original: By ELISABETTA POVOLEDO and ALAN COWELL
byline.contributor: Elisabetta Povoledo reported from Rome, and Alan Cowell from London. Rick Gladstone contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The cargo is part of a 1,300-ton stockpile of toxins removed from Syria under an international deal brokered last year and brought to Italy.

headline.main: U.S. Vessel to Tote Poison Gas From Syria to Sea
headline.print_headline: U.S. Vessel to Tote to Sea Poison Gas From Syria

keywords.value: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
keywords.name: organizations
